name: auth-check-header-php
description: The file contains PHP conditional statements to verify the validity of an authorized group. No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were detected. The conditional check is based on the `$AUTHORIZED_GROUP` variable, returning an HTTP 200 OK response if its value is greater than or equal to 0; otherwise, it terminates.
code_snippet:
<?
if($AUTHORIZED_GROUP>=0)
{
	echo "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\n";
	echo "Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8\n";
}
else
{
	exit;
}
?>
notes: No sensitive information or encoded data was detected.

name: info-disclosure-wireless-auth
description: Analysis of '.REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER' revealed no directly hardcoded credentials. However, a potential information disclosure vulnerability was identified in the included 'get_Wireless.php' file. When the 'REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER' GET parameter is set to 1, the system may expose wireless authentication details, including WEP keys, WPA PSK keys, and RADIUS keys. While no actual hardcoded credentials were found, security risks exist if this parameter is not properly protected.
notes: REDACTED_SENSITIVE_DATA
